snippet: The doubling of the interest rates on student loans cannot be allowed to stand.
abstract: Editorial criticizes Congress for allowing interest rate on subsidized federal loans to double from 3.4 to 6.8 percent; contends burden will fall on millions of low-income students who can least afford it; demands lawmakers adopt Democratic provision that would extend lower rate for additional year, during which they could restructure loan system.
lead_paragraph: The doubling of the interest rates on student loans cannot be allowed to stand.

keywords.value: Institute for College Access and Success
keywords.name: organizations
